newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks set new records on profit reports.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks set new records on profit reports.

text.p: Toronto stocks scaled new heights for a second straight day on Thursday, buoyed by favorable corporate earnings reports.
The TSE 300 Composite Index overcame early profit-taking to end up 19.99 points at a record close of 6785.15.
Almost 93 million shares were traded, worth C$1.76 billion ($1.2 billion).
The key index also set an intraday high of 6787.37.
"We had the makings of a significant deterioration earlier today. But the market was fueled by excellent earnings reports," said Ira Katzin, an investment advisor with RBC Dominion Securities.
Communications, conglomerates and transportation led gains in 10 of 14 sub-groups. The weak side included financial services, precious metals, utilities and pipelines.
Advancing stocks outpaced declines 516 to 448, with 321 issues unchanged.

* Canadian National Railway Co. ended up 2.70 at 69.80 after earlier soaring to a 52-week high of 73.50. The railway firm reported a 74 percent jump in second-quarter net income late on Wednesday. Canadian National pushed the transport group up 123 points or 1.5 percent.

* Canadian Pacific Ltd. added 1.20 to close at 43.30 after earlier reaching a 52-week peak of 43.45. CP reported sharply higher second-quarter earnings on Wednesday. The stock powered a 200-point gain in the conglomerates group on Thursday.
* BioChem Pharma Inc. rose 2.50 to 40.50 after a U.S. analyst raised his earnings estimates for the biotechnology player based on "spectacular" second-quarter results.
* Airline operator Air Canada led heavy traders, adding 0.35 to 11.90 on 2.5 million shares.
* Methanex Corp. improved 0.30 to 13.10. The world's biggest methanol producer said on Thursday it was cash rich and would have the means to fund a major project or distribution to shareholders.
